name: Aristotle, Scientist and Philosopher Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what Macedonian village was Aristotle born?
What was the name of the school that Aristotle established in a grove sacred to Apollo?
What was the name of Aristotle's father, which he used to name one of his works?
questions.explanation:
Nicomachus.

	The famous work which bore his father's name was 'Nicomachean Ethics'.

questions.text: Another name for the school mentioned in question number 2 can be translated from the Greek as 'walking around'. What is this familiar name?
What famous individual was taught by Aristotle?
questions.explanation:
Alexander the Great.

	Aristotle's father, Nicomachus, was the court physician to Alexander's father Philip.

Plato.

	Aristotle eventually rejected many of the theories of Plato, including that of the 'ideal forms'.

questions.text: The earliest writings of Aristotle cover what subject?
questions.explanation:
Biology.

	Aristotle was influenced early on by his father, who was a doctor.

questions.text: Which of the following was not a form of soul in Aristotle's work 'On the Soul'?
Which of the following biological topics did Aristotle not examine in detail?
options: habits and development of octopuses and squids
anatomy of the stomachs of ruminants

questions.text: Which of the following is not an important Aristotelian work?
questions.explanation:
psychology.

	Psychology wasn't big during Aristotle's time, apparently...
